title: Sadfishing: A cry for help or the scourge of the internet? Our readers weigh in
text:
"During high school, I had times of severe depression. Not being able to tell my thoughts or problems to friends or family, I sought my help in social media. It was a huge (not so smart) step, but it got nice comments as well.

"I was feeling slightly better because people were comforting me. But months later, I began picking up conversations about me in which people were criticising my way of looking for help."

The story of this 17-year-old, who goes by the name of "A" online, is common among the many teenagers and children who turn to the internet to seek validation or help to cope with mental health issues. Unfortunately, many have become the targets of bullying, harassment, or are simply told...
